humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that there are 10 lymph nodes examined in total, and metastatic carcinoma is found in 2 of them. This corresponds to N1 stage according to the AJCC staging system. Specifically, the report indicates pN1a, which refers to metastases in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes. However, the report does not provide information about the exact number of positive lymph nodes between 1 and 3, so we cannot determine a more specific N1 substage.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient has metastatic carcinoma in 2 out of 8 axillary lymph nodes, as per the pathology report. This corresponds to a pathologic N1a stage (TNM staging system).
